cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (85 km) ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest today, turning north-northwest Tuesday, then accelerating north-northeast along the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England by Friday-Saturday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: West-central Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key/Tampa Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches presently confined to the Florida Keys, Florida Bay, and Florida’s west coast from Englewood to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for west-central Cuba, the lower Florida Keys (Craig Key westward), and Florida west coast Flamingo–Englewood; Hurricane Warning for Cienfuegos–Matanzas Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. southeast coast from Florida through the Carolinas, extending northward to the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England (including New Jersey) late this week
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely 25–35 mph gusts Friday night–early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware Bay or lower Delaware River
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday as Elsa passes offshore; localized higher totals possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief, isolated tornado threat cannot be ruled out as outer rain-bands sweep across New Jersey late Friday
